This vignette documents the exact structure expected by title_footer_decorator() for the Excel specification file. The decorator expects a sheet that lists table identifiers and, for each table, a TITLE row and zero-or-more FOOTNOTE rows.

The function expects the titles to be in the first sheet named "Sheet1".

```{r required-columns, echo = FALSE}
cols <- data.frame(
  Column = c("TABLE_ID", "IDENTIFIER", "TEXT"),
  Type = c("character", "character", "character"),
  Required = c("yes", "yes", "yes"),
  Description = c(
    "Identifier for the table/report (e.g., TSFAE01A). Used as the key to match titles/footnotes to outputs.",
    "Allowed values: TITLE or FOOTNOTEX (e.g., FOOTNOTE1). TITLE indicates main title; FOOTNOTEX entries are footnotes.",
    "Text content to be used for the title or footnote (free text)."
  ),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

knitr::kable(cols, caption = "Required columns in the `titles` sheet")
```
